claims: The Sun is a gaseous body.
The Sun has no solid surface.

state.response: سورج ایک گیس دار جسم ہے جس کی کوئی ٹھوس سطح نہیں ہے۔
claims: The Sun is a gaseous body.
The Sun has no solid surface.

Is the Sun a gaseous body? Composition of the Sun

The Sun, like all stars, is an enormous ball of extremely hot, largely ionized gas, shining under its own power. And we do mean enormous. The Sun could fit 109 Earths side-by-side across its diameter, and it has enough volume (takes up enough space) to hold about 1.3 million Earths.
Is the Sun a gaseous body? Composition of the Sun

Is the Sun a gaseous body? Composition of the Sun
The composition of the sun can be described in several ways. By modern estimates, the composition by mass is: 71% H, 27% He, and 2% other heavier elements.

Does the Sun have a solid surface? Sun solid surface existence
The Sun visible to our eyes is a giant ball of plasma, or electrified gas, and does not have a solid surface like the Earth or Moon does.
Does the Sun have a solid surface? Sun solid surface existence
The sun has no surface. It is like a cloud or fog, just a boundary that constantly changes based on pressure, temperature, and contents.

Does the Sun have a solid surface? Sun solid surface existence
The Sun doesn't have a solid surface like Earth and the other rocky planets and moons. The part of the Sun commonly called its surface is the photosphere.
